title: The reason why Illaois winrate dropped so much is because Riot gutted her with a ninja nerf
body:
If enemies are hit with multiple tentacles, every tentacle after the first does 50% damage.

So if 3 tentacles hitting before did 300% damage, now they do 200% damage.

So early game if 2 tentacles would normally do 180 damage, now they do 135.

She's a lane bully with strong poke, good heals, and can solo anyone. I don't think there's anything wrong with her. In fact she's still pretty overwhelming in lane but falls off hard mid to late when she can't take more than 2 people

Hmm, can see you aren't going to be persuaded by words. I'd just suggest you try it out for about a month then, playing off-meta ranged/mages into Illaoi and see what happens. I picked up Illaoi near her release cause I thought she might be nifty so I do have a decent amount of playtime on her, not just shooting off blind. In my experience, she is extremely vulnerable to that in lane, while at the same time not disincentivizing it because she has weak team fighting and teleganks, unlike many other meta top laners. That is bad news for her in this snowball meta.

I'm not saying mage tops can't win. I'm just saying it's unreasonable. Why go Annie top or Karma top to counter an illaoi when almost anyone can outplay her and there's safer and stronger late game picks.

A few reasons to do it.

1. Your JG and Mid both went AD, which is super common >.<, and you want some magic damages for a more balanced comp.

2. "Stronger pick" is relative. Sometimes having that mage with high control and burst damage is more valuable than a more standard pick, if the enemy doesn't have an answer to it. If durability is a concern, bruiser built mages are still very effective damage wise and survivability.

3. The only thing safer than Morgana is something with a bunch of dash/blink mobility. Karma isn't quite as safe as Morg, but her speed, shield, root/heal, and slow can get her out of most bad spots.

4. All three of those specific mages I listed can top/mid/sup, so are reasonable flex picks to throw the enemy off, so long as your team is willing to be flexible as well. So I kinda like them for when I'm first pick and heavily risking a counter pick.

All in all, its the same reason people were taking Lulu top/mid for the longest time. Other mages can do the same thing Lulu does if you have the experience to play the matchups.

That is a bug since release. If the tentacles dont hit at the same time (with double tntacles by W for example) there is a one second window with much less dmg.

This has been mentioned elsewhere, throwing it in here as well just for the visibility though. Damage reduction on multiple tentacles has been on Illaoi since her release. We'll add mention of it to a tooltip at some point.
Why would a a seemingly crucial bit of information like that be left out? I'm just curious as to the choice for that

Not 100% certain, it's been a while since we wrote Illaoi's tooltips, so can't recall discussion around them. Could be that it got removed unintentionally when shifting text around between the different tooltips (something like got taken off individual abilities to add it to the passive but never got added to the passive). Might also have been a call not to mention it simply because of the length of Illaoi's tooltips at the time and its lack of impact on in game decision making versus emphasizing other information that does drive play more.
